title: Research
text:
Overview
My research is driven by a long-term goal of advancing personalized medicine. I focus on integrating MRI, pathology imaging, and artificial intelligence to improve cancer diagnosis, prognosis, and treatment, with the ultimate aim of making therapies more precise, efficient, and accessible for every patient.
I am particularly interested in:

Multimodal imaging integration: Combining MRI and pathology data to capture the full complexity of tumors and improve diagnostic accuracy.

Machine learning for therapy personalization: Developing predictive models that help clinicians select the optimal treatment for individual patients.

Translational impact: Creating tools that can be incorporated into clinical workflows to support real-world patient care.












Future Directions
Looking ahead, I aim to expand my work to broader applications of personalized medicine, combining imaging, genomics, and AI-driven decision support to help bring precision therapies from the lab to the clinic efficiently.

title: Sofiya Vyshnya
text:
Welcome to my website!
I am an MD-PhD student in Biomedical Engineering at Case Western Reserve University, dedicated to advancing personalized medicine. My research integrates MRI, pathology imaging, and artificial intelligence to improve cancer care and make therapies more streamlined, affordable, and accessible. Beyond the lab, I am passionate about science communication, mentoring, and community outreach.

title: Contact
text:
I welcome questions, collaboration inquiries, and discussions about research, outreach, or personalized medicine initiatives.

title: About
text:
I am an MD-PhD student in Biomedical Engineering at Case Western Reserve University, where I am pursuing my long-term goal of advancing personalized medicine. I am deeply motivated by the belief that medical care should be tailored to each individual‚Äîmaking treatments not only more effective, but also more streamlined, affordable, and accessible to all patients.
My current research focuses on integrating MRI, pathology imaging, and artificial intelligence to personalize cancer management. By combining insights across different imaging modalities with advanced computational methods, I aim to develop tools that help clinicians deliver the right treatment to the right patient at the right time.
Beyond research, I am passionate about science communication, mentoring, and community outreach. I enjoy helping others discover science, supporting students as they find their paths in STEM, and engaging with the public to make complex scientific ideas approachable and meaningful.
Looking ahead, I aspire to build a career at the intersection of medicine, engineering, and innovation, working toward a future where personalized medicine is the standard of care.

text: If you want Quarto to automatically generate a blog listing, it will look for posts in the same folder (blog/) and list them chronologically.
